roles.suggestion_title: Primary text in each autocomplete result row. Large, prominent text that identifies the item.
roles.suggestion_subtitle: Secondary text below the title in autocomplete results. Smaller, muted color. Shows supplementary info (year, author, etc.).
roles.suggestion_image: Thumbnail image on the left side of each autocomplete result row. Small square or rounded image.
roles.suggestion_url: Hidden field. The URL used to navigate to the item detail when the user taps a suggestion. Not displayed in UI.
roles.title: Main item heading at the top of the detail screen. Large, bold text. One per item.
roles.subtitle: Secondary text next to or below the title in the header area. Used for key identifying info (e.g., winery name for wines).
roles.cover: Main image for the item at the top of the detail screen. Supports different aspect ratios (vertical for posters/books, square for albums/apps, flexible for links).
roles.favicon: Small icon image, typically a website favicon. Displayed as a tiny square image near the URL or source info.
roles.expandable_text: Long-form text with a 3-line preview that expands on tap. Supports markdown formatting. Used for descriptions and summaries.
roles.slide_badge: Small pill-shaped card in a horizontal scrolling row. Shows a compact value, optionally with an icon (‚≠ê rating, üìÖ date, üïê duration). Multiple badges scroll side by side.
roles.attribute_label: Key-value property row. Displays a label and a value stacked vertically in the detail view. The most common role for topic-specific metadata.
roles.link: Tappable URL that opens in a browser or in-app browser. Displayed as an action button or clickable text.
roles.button: Action button in the toolbar or action area. Triggers a purchase flow or external action (e.g., Buy button).
roles.tab_content: Content displayed in a separate tab within the detail screen. Used for long lists (ingredients, cooking steps) that deserve their own scrollable section.
roles.map_view: Interactive map view showing a geographic location. Renders a MapKit/Google Maps embed with a pin at the specified coordinates.
